avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is in general low. During the course of the day loose wet-snow avalanches which could be triggered in extremly steep, rocky slopes can be sponaneously triggered. These avalanches are mostly small to medium sized. Occasionaly fresh snowdrift deposits could be triggered as small slab avalanches.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The avalanche danger is slightly increasing during the course of the day.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow base is predominantly stable. In high altitudes on shady slopes powder-like snow is found in places. Occasionaly fresh driftsnow deposits have formed due to soutwesterly winds. The snow surface is mostly icy or with hoar. The surface  gets quickly moist (early spring firn) and wet  in sunny areas. During the night the snow cover can cool down and solidify.

tendency.highlights: On Saturday it can be partially cloudy (Clouds in medium altitudes), but it will stay mild and no precipitation is called. The avalanche danger will stay low.

weatherForecast.comment: A high pressure system with dry air masses is dominating the weather in the eastern Alps. After a cool night, Fridaywill be sunny and the visibility will be excellent.  In the eastern half of Styria brisk southwesterly winds are called which weakens during the afternoon. Temperatures are rising quickly during the course of the day and will be around 2 to 4 degrees in 2.000 m at noon.

customData.generalHeadline: Good Mountain weather, but very little amount of snow!
